result.execSummary:
The defendant Laura L. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

ADDRESS INFO for Laura L. Anderson
Current: 508 3rd Street, Mosinee, WI 54455 United States  (Effective: 10-31-2016)
Prior: 717 Mcclellan Street, Wausau, WI 54403

Case Called: 3:55 pm
INCLUDES 16CF302, 16CF477, 15CF536, 15CF1077.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Genelle Johnson.
PLEA HEARING IN 16CF302 AND 16CF477:
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
16CF302:
Ct. 4 (Neglecting a Child-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 5 (Neglecting a Child-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 6 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia-Repeater)>>DRI.

16CF477:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)-Repeater))>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
16CF302:
Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 2 (Neglecting a Child-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 3 (Neglecting a Child-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
16CF302:
Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 3 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/Treatment/Counseling as recommended, AODA and follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within that prescribed amount, Maintain Full time work/Full time work or a combination, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court authorizes Defendant to attend Lakeside Treatment through NCHCC.

Ct. 2 (Neglecting a Child-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/Treatment/Counseling as recommended, AODA and follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within that prescribed amount, Maintain Full time work/Full time work or a combination, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court authorizes Defendant to attend Lakeside Treatment through NCHCC.

Ct. 3 (Neglecting a Child-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/Treatment/Counseling as recommended, AODA and follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within that prescribed amount, Maintain Full time work/Full time work or a combination, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court authorizes Defendant to attend Lakeside Treatment through NCHCC.

SENTENCING HEARING ON REVOCATION ON 15CF536 AND 15CF1077:
COURT ORDERS: 
15CF536:
Ct, 1 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs)>> 10 Months MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination, Concurrent, No Objection to EMP. Court finds 172 days credit. All outstanding obligations to be converted to a civil judgment. Court authorizes Defendant to attend Lakeside Treatment through NCHCC.

Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>> 10 Months MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination, Concurrent, No Objection to EMP. Court finds 172 days credit. All outstanding obligations to be converted to a civil judgment. Court authorizes Defendant to attend Lakeside Treatment through NCHCC.

15CF1077:
Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>> 10 Months MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination, Concurrent, No Objection to EMP. Court finds 172 days credit. All outstanding obligations to be converted to a civil judgment. Court authorizes Defendant to attend Lakeside Treatment through NCHCC.
